name: jInterflex
short_description: jInterflex is a Java open source library that invokes methods and reads public fields of classes through reflection in a different way, using annotations and interfaces. jInterflex allows to specify the methods to be invoked and the public fields to be read in auxiliary interfaces, with the same signature that they actually have (or very similar), so the signatures of methods can be copied almost directly from the Javadocs of their original classes. With the help of this interfaces, the access to the methods and constants looks like the "normal" (without reflection) invokation or read access, enhancing the readability.
summary: A Java library to make reflection calls using annotations

license.fullpath: License :: OSI-Approved Open Source :: MIT License

audience.fullpath: Intended Audience :: by End-User Class :: Developers
